column4: unix is user friendly, it's just picky about who it's friends are ;)
that stops pluseaudio from starting at boot - "sudo update-rc.d pulseaudio defaults" might add it back
gave an erroe that states "runlevel arguments do not match

sorry i don't know then.  (side not: update-rc.d is outdated in ubuntu, i doubt it should be used).  Perhaps your original command didn't do anything?  i'd restart, and verify pulse is ok - before worrying about it then.
